cleaned_text: Last Name First Name Middle Initial Date of Birth Hepatitis B Vaccination Record Card The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends the hepatitis B vaccine for all newborns,children, adults 19-59 years of age, and adults 60 and older who are at high-risk for infection. The hepatitis B vaccine is safe, and highly effective. Please keep this vaccine card for your health records. D o s e 1 D o s e 2 D o s e 3Dose of Vaccine Date Given Date for Next DoseNow1 month after dose 13-dose vaccine series 2-dose vaccine series (hepatitis A and B), PreHevbrioDose 1 Dose 2 Dose 3 VaccineU.S. Adult Hepatitis B Vaccine Schedules 6 months after dose 1 The hepatitis B vaccine is 2 or 3-doses, and can be given over 1 month or 6 months depending on what vaccine you receive. Please see the chart below to see when to schedule your next dose. The below vaccines are NOT interchangeable. You must recieve the same vaccine for all doses. Please check which vaccine you are receiving: I got the two-dose vaccine (Heplislav-B) I got the three-dose vaccine (PreHevbrio, Engerix-B, Recombivax-B, Twinrix) I f y o u h a v e a n y q u e s t i o n s f o r c o n c e r n s a b o u t t h e v a c c i n e , p l e a s e a s k y o u r h e a l t h c a r e p r o v i d e r .
